content.label: Telepaint achieves things other puzzle games can‚Äôt. It has and amazing soundtrack and creative concept. It starts off with only being able to teleport, but then you discover new gimmicks in every single world. I had a lot of fun playing this game and found it challenging. A good puzzle game should always have a challenge to it and add new things or gimmicks often. A puzzle game isn‚Äôt fun if it is the same thing spread out into thousands of levels. This game shows what puzzle games should be like on the App Store, and is truly amazing. In my opinion, this game is the most fun puzzle game I‚Äôve played on the App Store, and it also has the best soundtrack I‚Äôve heard out of all of the games on the App Store. If you are looking for an amazing puzzle game with a great soundtrack, this is it.

This is a very enjoyable puzzle game. Difficulty progresses gradually from super obvious to downright monstrous. Good level design helps keep things interesting. I‚Äôve never managed to beat the game but after being away from it for about a year I‚Äôm able to come back and enjoynplaying it from the beginning a second time. 

The art is cute and the splashy paint fun. I don‚Äôt see what the paint theme of the characters and the video theme of the interface have to do with either the gameplay or each other but it‚Äôs cute and fun enough that I don‚Äôt really care. 

A challenging and fun brain teaser that I can‚Äôt find any complaints with.

title.label: Balloon and Smoocher Crash Still on 5-14

content.label:
Perfect game, but the bug that was stated to be fixed in 1.6 is still present. 

Reproducing the issue (if it was different before):
Teleport the player to the left side, flipping the gravity and then teleport key balloon above the smoocher. Flip the gravity again and then teleport the player on top of the smoocher. This should crush the player against the balloon, but it crashes the game.

I‚Äôm on an iPhone 8, if that makes any difference.
One of a few number of games that I have enjoyed at all. 100% recommended

Whenever I play it just flashes the rainbow it says the play button I click it nothing happens then a bunch of ads go on my screen.Then my Device Turns black and a my battery dies because of your stupid game!

Simple puzzle game with neat mechanics and a lot of charm. I was afraid this would turn into a game requiring a nearly impossible series of perfectly-timed moves on each level. Thankfully, this was not the case. Highly recommend.

Spoilers:
Some great music in there! There are some nicely hidden bonus levels too ;)
The hdmi levels are awesome.
Loved it all the way. Such fun and unique puzzles that has you thinking about all possible solutions. Really love how everything works together in the later levels and the music is awesome.

The have concept seemed simple enough to me at first, and as I progressed the level design and mechanics really showed off how good and clever this game is.

HIGHLY recommended, can't wait for new levels!

I don't always write a review but this game is GREAT! 

Very puzzling and creative mechanics!
Tons of levels! Tons of fun!

Its starts off pretty simple but once you are getting used to mechanics they throw you a curveball. Each level is more challenging than the last and as a whole it is quite addictive. I give it a Tim and Eric "Great Job!"

UX Notes: When I hit the play button I would like to continue from the puzzle I am currently solving. Don't make me find it every time I open the game. 

Sound plays when I am listening to a podcast even if I turn it down all the way. Might be an iOs thing though.

This game seriosuly deserves more attention. The gameplay is refreshing and challenging, with each level getting steadily more difficult and sometimes requires outside of the box thinking. 
Soundtrack is addicting and fits the beat of the game perfectly. The main character-a paint can-is surprising cute. 
Complaints about bugs that I never encountered are dragging the rating down. Please support this amazing game and give it the praise it deserves üôè
The puzzles are not as hard as you think they are but they are brain teasing. The soundtrack is god tier. Please upload the soundtrack to iTunes or YouTube so I can just listen to it repeatedly.
Fun, leisurely puzzle game. Reminds me of the old Gameboy Mario vs. Donkey Kong. Very different but the same simple, single screen fun and challenge.
5 star
I downloaded this app to try. It opens and all I get is some repetitive screen playing over and over and over and NO GAME PLAY. I'm glad it was free otherwise I'd be really ticked off!

I just finished the two bonus worlds (an add on that only cost a single dollar) after completing the main game and can safely say that this is one of my favorite mobile puzzle games. The art and music/sound are cute and charming, and the gameplay is full of fun and creative ideas. 

Like classic Mario games, each world introduces a new gameplay mechanic that is taught to the player through some simple levels before moving on to more advanced scenarios. The pacing and gradual ramp up to more complex levels is perfectly balanced, and some of the later stages show some really creative uses of otherwise simple ideas. 

Aside from the expansion with extra worlds that can be purchased for a dollar (which is a steal!), there are no in-app purchases trying to nickel and dime you or waste your time to annoy you into spending money. You just buy the game and get a solid well developed experience. 

I can't say it enough but I absolutely love this game and hope people reward this type of game development by picking up this charming title. It's sad to see that it got hit with negative reviews because of some compatibility issues that have seen even patched out. If you're reading this, give this game a shot.
This puzzle game kept my interest through all levels. It's pretty rare that I continue to play a puzzler all the way to the last puzzle.
The game was an enjoyable and at times frustrating puzzle game until it ended.

Triggers an in app purchase attempt on load. Every single time.

I love this game! So cheerful, love the nostalgia and music and happy little paint buckets. Difficult enough to keep me interested but not so difficult that it becomes frustrating. Such great detail, too. Great job!

The goal is simple, move a into adorable paint can to his brush, but it is getting to that point where this game shines. The game has a very natural system of progression, and ramps up the difficulty at a generous, but challenging pace. I highly recommend for any casual player, or lover of puzzle games.

title.label: Are you trying to kill people with seizures?

The puzzles, gameplay, etc are extremely fun at first, but as you continue to play, it all seems the same. Sure, it introduces new mechanics, but most of the puzzles are putting a box in a portal. I already saw the same puzzle twice, except one of them consisted of two boxes instead of one.

The paint part is kind of dumb as it serves no role in this game. And why are the portals colored differently? So they can splash around different colors? Why not just make it an rng based thing instead?

There is a bug where if you collect a key and restart the level on the same frame, the blockade the key removed will have disappeared. However, the key is still present and collectible.

I recommend this game if you enjoy puzzles. Just be wary of the few bugs.
I'm not saying you won't like it I just don't like it

While this does seem like a very fun game, I am unable to even open the game up when it finishes downloading. The buttons turn frozen and I'm unable to click anything. I also use an iPad. It seems like I'm not the only person dealing with this issue either. Until you are able to fix this, I am giving it one star.
